item.title: Installing VirtualBox 7.1.0 on macOS and installing a Linux guest machine with Ubuntu 22.04.5 LTS
item.description: Gist: Developer Notes: Installing VirtualBox 7.1.0 on macOS and installing a Linux guest machine with Ubuntu 22.04.5 LTS Rather than cloning the changes in two different places, I’m linking the developer notes shared on my GitHub repository here: https://github.com/vguhesan/devnotes-virtualbox Presentation Slides: PowerPoint version | PDF version Cheers! If you would like to show your support then consider subscribing below and/or buy me a cup of joe (I live on coffee and coffee makes me a better scribe):

item.title: **fix** VirtualBox installer fails on Windows 11 (program compatibility issue)
item.description: What is this article about? When you try to install VirtualBox v.6.1.30 on Windows 11, you will see the following error: This app can't run on this device: This app can’t run because it causes security performance issue on Windows. A new version may be available. Check with your software provider for an updated version that runs on this version of Windows. It will further prevent you from executing the installer.

item.title: Python pycharm - configuring remote interpreters from Windows to Linux
item.description: If you are an avid Python developer, you may all be excited about the new features available in the Pycharm 2.5 release, especially the remote interpreters, virtualenv and setup.py support. You can read more about the new exciting features here . But as I started to tinker with the “remote interpreter” feature - I stumbled upon some challenges and I thought I’d document them for other PyCharm users who might benefit from this blog entry.
